reviewText: This disc features stellar performances from some legendary and up and coming jazz musicians. The Dolby True HD audio track of this disc is demo quality.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Having read a review at Hi Def Digest saying that this looks better than any material shot on film ever will, I ran to buy this disc (along with Chris Botti's favorably reviewed BD). I do not know what these people were thinking? Music, performances and sound are great, but this looks awfull and not wothy of a Hi Def disc. Really, some upscaled DVD's are looking much better. Very disappointing...

reviewText: I was looking forward to this blu-ray music, but was disappointed in the overall variety of the music. There were one or two at best selections that I really enjoyed, but would not recommend.
Title: N/A

reviewText: PQ for a concert/show type blu-ray is very good but not great.AQ is better than the PQ, it lets you hear each instrument in the mix with pretty good clarity and presence and overall the soundtrack sounds very dynamic as well. I don't think it's perfect from an audiophile/purist point of view but it is nonetheless very, very good.
summary: Good fun but should be longer and include more artists...
Title: N/A

reviewText: This disc is a must-own if you like Jazz and have a Blu-ray player.  The video is outstanding, but the audio will blow you away.The entire disc is in Dolby TrueHD, so you get 100% lossless audio.  It is pristine.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you have a Blu-ray player and enjoy Jazz this is a must have.  Each performance is great.  The styles of Jazz vary from performer to performer.  I like a variety of music so this was not a problem for me. It shouldn't for most either, since, after all, the performers are "Jazz Legends". The most benefit from this disc will be to those who have their Blu-ray hooked up to an audio system and especially if you can take advantage of the Dolby Tru-HD sound track here.  There is also a two channel uncompressed sound track.  I haven't been one to embrace multi-channel music but this disc is an excellent example of how surround sound music can be done right and with Tru-HD listening becomes quite an experience.  The mix is done as if you are in the audience.  The instruments are in front of you with just enough to surround speakers to give ambience to the music.  The video, of course, being in high definition, is stunning as well.  Legends of Jazz on Blu-ray is a real audio video treat and the price is no more than a typical CD.  Looking forward to hopefully seeing more of this series come to Blu.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Legends of Jazz is a good sampling of a variety of jazz artists, most of them past their prime. For example, Dave Brubeck died just a few days ago. But if you have a blu-ray player, the blu-ray version is about the same price as the DVD and looks great.
Title: N/A
